byline.contributor: Shuaib Almosawa reported from Sana and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By SHUAIB ALMOSAWA and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Local officials report bombs dropped by planes from Saudi Arabia-led coalition killed 70 people at Yemeni wedding; coalition, which denies attack took place, is under increasing fire for causing civilian casualties in its campaign against Houthi rebels in Yemen's civil war; United States, which provides logistical support to coalition, has yet to publicly rebuke it.
lead_paragraph: Attacks that killed at least 70 people along Yemen’s Red Sea coast added to criticism of the Saudi-led military alliance for failing to adequately distinguish between military and civilian targets.

headline.main: Airstrikes in Yemen Hit Wedding Party, Killing Dozens
headline.print_headline: Warplanes Hit Wedding in Yemen, Reports Say

snippet: Attacks that killed at least 70 people along Yemen’s Red Sea coast added to criticism of the Saudi-led military alliance for failing to adequately distinguish between military and civilian targets.
